This is actually a pretty tame response. I almost put it in the gun control thread as with the recent private citizens that patrolled the border it begins to raise militia questions potentially and state's rights.
 
 http://us.cnn.com/2005/US/08/12/newmexico/index.html
 
 

 
 New Mexico Gov. Bill Richardson declared a state of emergency Friday in four counties along the Mexican border that he said have been "devastated" by crimes such as the smuggling of drugs and illegal immigrants.
 
 The declaration said the region "has been devastated by the ravages and terror of human smuggling, drug smuggling, kidnapping, murder, destruction of property and the death of livestock. ...
 
 "[It] is in an extreme state of disrepair and is inadequately funded or safeguarded to protect the lives and property of New Mexican citizens."

post_info.post_title: Border emergency declared in New Mexico

Nothing other than the main 'emergency' that the border counties face is economic. Most are near bankruptcy as a result of the burden of the healthcare costs of treating Mexican citizens who walk through the doors of ERs across the South West. Pretty much the entire social welfare net is stressed far in excess in the border counties, with little to no help from the federal government. Although the biger culprit IMO is the Mexican government. It would be helpful, if as the article suggests, they demolish these havens on the border that aren't even occupied by Mexican citizens. A paved highway that paralells the border isn't particualry helpful either. I think it is time for us to hand them a bill.
 
 The whole notion of a confrontation between individual states and the Mexican government raises interestign issues as well I think.

That's a political issue. Federal medicare funding to states (emergency services and aid to dependent children) has been and is being reduced as revenue sharing in general is diverted to the military budget and those services, complete with federal legislative compliance, become state burdens. Those who support our very expensive occupation of Iraq, where medical care is free, we're building hospitals and training medical personnel, are probably the same ones who volunteer for vigilante duty and complain about increased state and municipal expenditures. You can't have it both ways with a declining federal tax base in an economy driven by public and personal debt while pursuing nation building. Putting the US first is not and has not been a priority of current administration.

 here we go again...lets focus on the issue shall we...how illegals are treated...in the US, the police do not arrest any illegals, the border patrols just merely send back who ever they catch near the border....in the EU, the police arrest any illegals who have been caught...
 
 why is it that whenever , some thing critical is said about another country, immediately the response is to say that it also happens in the US without any sources to back it up....please back up your statement that the POLICE in the US mistreat illegals...the truth of the matter is the police do not get involved with illegals...focus on the issue ...how illegals are treated in europe as compared to the US

In Europe, they are generally treated in the following manner:
 
 Once surprised by the police/border guard, they are rounded up if they try to run. Then, the police discover none of them have any ID, since they throw them away/hide them so the coutry that apprehends them has a harder job figuring out where to return them. A lot of them ask for asylum.
 
 As the process of figuring out who is who, where to return him and whether or not he is entitled to asylum, they are kept in a special transition house. Their movement is limited, and as the facilities are too limited to adequately house them all, the conditions are rather problematic: overcrowded, hygiene problems and similar.
 
 There may be some police excesses, but not any more than against any other person that gets treated by the police. Anecdotal accounts of immigrants getting beaten are actually rarer than the anecdotal accounts of rowdy youngsters getting beaten by the police while resisting arrest.
 
 While "immigrants arriving on the brink of death" situations are rare, since there is no border desert, the condition of some immigrants arriving into italy on ancient, rusted through fishing boats and similar (cigarettes, on the other hand are smuggled with speedboats, go figure) are quite dire.
P.S. then they get deported back to wherever they came from.

 In europe as you have noted , they are deported back once caught by the police or border guards...in the US, the police do not get involved with illegals which means once they get past the border patrol, they are home free.

As opposed to
 
 
 
 It was you who brought it up, mae, not Wez. You started throwing around accusations, supported with a single anecdotal account. Since Wez offered contrary arguments, it is up to you to strenghten your proposal that Europeans treat immigrants worse. Also, from monitoring local papers, where stories of apprehended immigrants abound (we are one of the major entry points), I find no supporting evidence for your claim the anecdotal account is actually representative. You also yet have to adress Wez's counter about the number of illegal immigrants.

 
 Here we go again , I was not repeat talking about immigrants , but ILLEGAL immigrants..I never said anecdotal evidence is representative......don't put words into my mouth...it is a tired worn out trick that never works.
 
 I did not throw around accusations , in fact you have backed up my statements with your statements that in europe ILLEGAL immigrants are put in detention facilities with their freedom of movement restricted....In the US , once the illegals get past the border patrol, they can never be put in detention facilities and have their freedom of movement restricted as the police never get involved with arresting illegals...they are home free.

Goodby Wez.......lets see, any anecdotal evidence that you do not like is now dismissed by you....so again proves my point that you cannot accept what you do not like...
 
 Goodbye for good

 I gave anecdotal evidence for illegal immigrants being abused by the US police as well.
 
 Either way, I'm really interested where you got the figures of 15-20 million illegal immigrants. I gave figures showing something to the contrary, as well as anecdotal evidence showing how the US police abuse illegal immigrants.
 
 -Wez

Here we go again , I was not repeat talking about immigrants , but ILLEGAL immigrants..I never said anecdotal evidence is representative......don't put words into my mouth...it is a tired worn out trick that never works.
 
 I did not throw around accusations , in fact you have backed up my statements with your statements that in europe ILLEGAL immigrants are put in detention facilities with their freedom of movement restricted....In the US , once the illegals get past the border patrol, they can never be put in detention facilities and have their freedom of movement restricted as the police never get involved with arresting illegals...they are home free.

 
 Oh no, you're not getting off the hook that easily. There is only one way I can reasonably interpret your post:
 
 
Wez, do you know how european countries treat ILLEGAL immigrants ? I am not talking about LEGAL immigrants who enter european countries the proper way....well if you don't , google or yahoo 'illegal immigrants in europe' and read up on it....

 
 This is an implied statement that the EU mistreats illegal immigrants. Considering that it is followed by an account of police brutality against an immigrant, the implication is even, that the illegal immigrants are physically abused. That is throwing around accusations. If not, I'd appreciate an explanation of your logic. If the anecdote is not indicative of the general treatment, why was it brought up in this fashion, as it would be like illustrating a rule with an exception, without even a preface indicating it is an exception. Especially since the example is finished by:
 
well for sure this is not the first time it must have happened...how about all the other illegal immigrants who are mistreated out of the public eye...

 
 So accusations there are. As for the described treatment of the illegal immigrants, I described no violence beyond the standard measures applied against all illegal activities: prevention of illegal activity, apprehension of persons committing illegal activities and use of force corresponding to the illegal activities. Nothing beyond regular cops.
 
 As for the illegal immigrants, they have no permission to enter the territory of the EU and are thus returned to their point of origin. If this is unclear, or they are claiming asylum, they are restricted to the transitory premises. This is not prison, it is more akin to quaranteen, as no punishment is intended.
 
 As for the US, I do believe the standard threat to illegal immigrants, used to keep those exploited workers in line is the threat of calling the immigration bureau, so US "free to stay" is no better than the EU. In EU, you also have an awful lot of illegal immigrants who manageto evade police control.

Oh no, you're not getting off the hook that easily. There is only one way I can reasonably interpret your post:

That is throwing around accusations. If not, I'd appreciate an explanation of your logic.  So accusations there are.  You know that the statement I have highlighted is so off base....
 
 There is a vast difference between what happens to illegals in the US once the get past the border patrol and illegals in europe once they get past the border guards...
 
 No matter how hard you try to put on a bright face to those detention facilities that illegals are kept in europe, their movements are restricted, their freedom is restricted.. they cannot get driver's licences..they cannot work, etc.....in the US, illegals once they get past the border patrols are free...and how many cases do you seriously have of employers threatening to call the immigration bureau...first of all if the employers depend on illegals , the last thing they want is the immigration bureau nosing around as employers can be fined for hiring illegals...so what you say is highly unlikely (maybe it happens but so rarely which in effect means that for the most part illegals in US are home free unlike in europe.
 
 And further more you fail to mention that the US grants amnesty to Illegals once in a while ( under Regan I believe) in which millions of illegals are given the opportunity to become citizens...very few european countries do that (I know of only Spain) , the vast majority will never give amnesty to illegals.
 
 You say that the EU has an 'awful lot' of illegals who are not caught ....do you have any evidence to back it up and are the numbers in any way comparable to the numbers in the US ?

You know that the statement I have highlighted is so off base....
 Yes i do, and so does Wez. That's why we attacked it.
 
 Your idea that the immigrants are free to stay once they get across the US border is rather wrong. The US are quite capable of deporting unwanted illegal immigrants:
 http://www.cnn.com/US/9610/28/briefs.pm/illegal.html (1997)
 http://66.102.9.104/search?q=cache:Q-http://usinfo.state.gov/gi/Archive/2004/Nov/22-333809.html (2004)
 - You deport an awful lot of people you describe as "free to stay". And before you focus on the criminals bit (half - so 75000 clean ones were deported), it only shows that the US is quite willing to deport unwanted illegal immigrants. Where these were kept in the period between their capture and the time they were deported I don't know, but I'll bet it's either prison or detention center.
 
 What is true is that the US is rather tolerant of illegal immigration, however, this is mostly due to the fact that employers do like to employ the illegal immigrants, who wouldn't. A third the cost of a legal worker, can't turn you in without turning himself in, you can lay him of at any time, no need to consider his rights, ... Happens in Europe, too. Human nature.
 
 I couldn't find any numbers for European deportations, unfortunately. However, I doubt the difference will be drastic.

Yes i do, and so does Wez. That's why we attacked it.

 Your silence on the issue of granting amnesty to illegal immgrants is very telling.......I wonder why ? Is it because the US has a better record than EU on that issue ?

No idea. We don't get any illegal immigrant amnesties in Slovenia for a simple reason: we are a transit country. Those we get, we deport, those we don't get we can't grant amnesty to because they go on to the richer EU countries. I'm having trouble finding data on EU illegal immigration because I'd have to find sources for all the countries, of which there are several, each pulishing news in its own language, which makes tracking hard. But then, you have also failed to provide any actual data on the number of amnesties...
 
 I do however wonder why you keep saying that our deportations are so strange. You yourself keep on claming that "once the immigrants get past the border guard, they are free". What about those that are caught BY the border guard? Are those not deported as well?
 
 However, I'm glad you finally dropped silent on the subject of EU immigrant beatings and US not deporting anyone...

All right, first single statistic. I can't vouch for the accuracy, but it's the first orientational value we have here:
 
 http://www.statewatch.org/news/sept00/12airexpel.htm
 
 1991 total number of expelled illegal immigrants at cca. 170000 - similar to US numbers.

No idea. We don't get any illegal immigrant amnesties in Slovenia for a simple reason: we are a transit country. Those we get, we deport, those we don't get we can't grant amnesty to because they go on to the richer EU countries. I'm having trouble finding data on EU illegal immigration because I'd have to find sources for all the countries, of which there are several, each pulishing news in its own language, which makes tracking hard.  I do however wonder why you keep saying that our deportations are so strange. You yourself keep on claming that "once the immigrants get past the border guard, they are free". What about those that are caught BY the border guard? Are those not deported as well?
 
 However, I'm glad you finally dropped silent on the subject of EU immigrant beatings and US not deporting anyone...

 
 
 It is laughable to compare the illegals who are turned away at the border to deportations.....There are millions who get past the border guards in the US (anybody who lives in LA can attest to it) and the few who get caught by the border guards try again and again....till they get through...no comparison at all....I am not silent at EU immigrant beatings, I wrote about anecdotal evidence that was told to me...I have nothing more to add....but the reaction to it told me a lot...some people went crazy !

Mae, get some numbers or stop making allegation. I posted deportation numbers for both the US and Europe, and they only list deportations, not "turned back at border", as these were not listed in either case. Same statistic, similar numbers. 
 
 (PS, the US number:, Between October 1, 2003, and April 30, 2004, 660,390 people were detained by the United States Border Patrol as they tried to cross the border illegally.)
 
 If you really want to talk about problems and make comparisons, here you have some really interesting points:
 -estimated illegal immigration: US 1.1 - 1.3 million per year, EU 0.5 million per year.
 -estimated number of illegal immigrants present in US: 15-20 million (statistic taken from anti-immigration sites, so a grain of salt is to be applied) , EU: 3-4 million (neutral statistic).
 
 While not as severe as the US situation, it is obvious that the EU is also facing a similar situation as the US. And EU does not have such efficient natural barriers to hide behind. In reference to the topic, the EU already is facing the same thing as the US, and the cries for border closure are no louder in the EU than they are in the US. And social security services available in the EU are an order of magnitude above the US levels.
 
 Abuse of illegal immigrants by the police does happen. An immigrant in Austria suffocated because his mouth was taped shut. However, these are isolated cases and I am sure such excesses could be found in the US. The problem is that you tried to silence everyone by making the crazy claim of "Wez, do you know how european countries treat ILLEGAL immigrants ?" and following with the single incident. Thus, both Wez and myself responded and I think I have shown that the treatment of illegal immigrants in the EU is far from what you insinuated.
 
 P.S., out illegal immigrants try and try again too. Go to an Italian tourist resort and observe the (predominantly black and thus easily spotted) people selling tourists cheap handbags and plastic statues of the local tourist attractions. Watch how they pack up and leave when they are warned of police sweeps. And also watch the police mostly ignore them when they aren't on a sweep against them...
 
 We are both facing the same thing. We are too rich, and we grew rich at the expense of foreigners, by either exploiting their economies or just by being too tough competition to them. To them, we are heaven on earth, and it is only natural that they want to come here. Walls are not the solution. making it worthwhile to stay might be.

mae: You citted 15-20million illegal immigrants coming to the US. Where did you get that number from? I found figures far lower.

To them, we are heaven on earth, and it is only natural that they want to come here. Walls are not the solution. making it worthwhile to stay might be.
